page.title: 04HARPSDEN
page.content: Harpsden appeared in the Domesday Book 1085 as HARPENDENE.Dene means a valley & the River Harp once ran through the Village.Now the spring runs underground & feeds into a pond near the Church.On one side of the valley are grass hills, Drawback, & on the other side wooded hills.The main part of the Village is along this valley & consists of St. MargaretÂ£s Church,Harpsden Court,houses Golf Course,Harpsden School,Village Hall & LucyÂ£s Farm,which keeps cows & pigs.There are no shops nor pubs. HARPSDEN SCHOOL was founded in 1858 by Thomas HALL & his two sisters to remember their brother Owen.Their Coat of Arms is on the front of the School. They lived at Bolney Court as did John HODGES,who gave a classroom in 1892 & two fields to the Village in 1849 & a VILLAGE HALL.The present one,1924, is used for meetings,socials & sport.
